episodes.title: Scientology's European Call to Arms - with Ruth White
episodes.description:
In the 1990s, the International Association of Scientologists put out a 'call to arms', mobilising thousands of parishioners across the globe to march for 'religious freedom' in Berlin and Paris. 

In her first public interview, Ruth White tells us how she was joined by Isaac Hayes, Kirstie Alley and thousands of fellow Scientologists in response to government criticism of the group.

https://www.iasprotest.com

episodes.title: The start of my exit from Scientology - On this day, 10 years on: 14th October
episodes.description:
Exactly 10 years ago, my journey out of Scientology began. In this new series, I will be looking at documents from my time on staff at the Church of Scientology London and taking you on the journey, in real time, that led to my exit.

Episode One: 14th October 2013 - Commendation and Board of Review CSW

episodes.title: Scientology left me £100,000 in DEBT and destroyed my marriage - Dave Griffiths
episodes.description:
When Dave Griffiths joined Scientology, he was promised it would build on his self-confidence and allow him to live at a higher level of existence. Instead, it destroyed his marriage and left him £108,000 in debt through bank loans arranged by the Church on his behalf. 

This is his story.

CHAPTERS
0:00:00 - Introduction
0:01:45 - What Dave was looking for when he joined
0:08:23 - First visit to the Org
0:17:33 - The £3,500 training package
0:25:30 - Scientology organised my bank loan
0:28:00 - Family problems
0:30:28 - “I was trapped”
0:41:14 - Another loan
0:47:10 - Staff loaned me money for courses
0:48:00 - £108,000 in debts
0:53:26 - It destroyed my marriage
1:01:08 - Saint Hill
1:12:47 - What happened when Dave heard about Xenu
1:19:36 - Can’t your family lend you the money?
1:30:26 - I was scared for my life
1:36:32 - Escaping Scientology
1:43:55 - Debt fraud scam
1:48:08 - Wrapping up

episodes.title: Cult Bingo: NXIVM vs Scientology with Sarah Edmonson - TSFU Podcast & A Little Bit Culty
episodes.description:
During her time in NXIVM, Sarah Edmonson worked closely with Keith Raniere and was responsible for recruiting new members to the group. After seeing the light, she joined forces with fellow member Mark Vicente and became an integral part in the cult's downfall - documented on HBO series The Vow.

Today, Sarah joins TSFU Podcast host Ashley Richards and I to discuss the similarities between NXIVM and Scientology, play cult bingo and compare our experiences as sales people for two of the world's most well-known coercive groups.

Listen to Sarah's podcast, A Little Bit Culty: https://alittlebitculty.com/
Check out Ash's podcast, That's So F**ed Up: https://tsfuthepodcast.com/

episodes.title: Scientology LOSES Swiss lawsuit after showing up to court with NO LAWYERS
episodes.description:
Judges in Switzerland have ruled against Scientology in a defamation case they brought against two activists. The three-year legal battle involved the Church of Scientology Basel, the Swiss Department of Health and Scientology spokespeople Jürg Stettler and Dierk Clausen and resulted in an embarrassing loss for the Church after they showed up to court with NO LAWYERS!!!

Read the article: https://www.scientologybusiness.com/scientology-news/scientology-lawsuit-backfires-swiss-court-rules-in-defamation-case-against-activists/

episodes.title: A $20 antibiotic could've saved my son's life. Now Scientology want to destroy me - Karen's story
episodes.description:
Married to Church of Scientology President Heber Jentzsch, Karen de la Carriere was one of only 8 people in the world trained to manage the world’s best 'auditors’.

When her son tragically died at the age of 27, she found out a simple antibiotic could've saved his life.. but Scientology wouldn't let him take it. Now, she is seen as a threat and Scientology are set on destroying her life.

This is Karen De La Carriere's story.

Chapters:
0:00:00 - Introduction
0:02:04 - They took away her son
0:04:59 - Scientology goes on the attack
0:11:11 - What motivates Scientology
0:15:40 - The future of the Church
0:23:08 - Fair Game
0:40:26 - How Scientology makes money
01:01:06 - Management by punishment

Follow Karen: @SurvivingScientology

episodes.title: Scientology's punishment hole wasn't just in the US: Inside the UK Rehabilitation Project Force
episodes.description:
Former Scientologist Danielle Chamberlin first joined the Sea Organization at the age of 11, where she served L. Ron Hubbard directly as one of his first 'Commodore's Messengers' aboard the Flagship Apollo. 

Disaffected and wanting to leave, Danielle was subject to Scientology's infamous 'RPF'. Join us as we learn her story and how Scientology's punishment techniques are not only enforced globally, but have been practiced for decades.

episodes.title: The lawyer taking on Scientology: Jonathan Coad on Tom Cruise, Leah Remini and 'Going Clear'
episodes.description:
Described by the media as an "indestructible warrior for his clients", Jonathan Coad doesn't mess around when it comes to fighting for justice. Responsible for the legal sign-off on major anti-Scientology publications and documentaries such as 'Going Clear' and the famous South Park Scientology episode, Jonathan has a wealth of experience in media, defamation and libel.

Join me as we discuss his work fighting the Church and the state of their public image.

episodes.title: Scientology Fraud: Major UK Bank Issues Statement - Natwest and the Chase Wave
episodes.description:
British bank NatWest, which was fined £264 million ($330 million USD) in 2021 for failing to prevent money laundering, has issued a statement in response to criticism after it was revealed Scientology has engaged in alleged credit card fraud and questionable financial activities. 

We asked: Is Scientology’s custom is being reviewed as part of the investigation into the debanking scandal?

episodes.title: Scientology under fire: Appeal of UK tax-exempt REJECTION ruled out by Charity Commission
episodes.description:
The UK Charity Commission has today confirmed its decision to refuse Scientology tax exempt status cannot now be appealed, upholding its view that “the Church of Scientology is not established for the public benefit“

Following a Freedom of Information Act request I made last month, the Charity Commission explained that due to a statute of limitations, it’s decision to deny Scientology tax exemption is now final and unalterable.

Read the article: https://www.scientologybusiness.com/tax-exemption/charity-commission-scientology-cannot-appeal-rejection-for-tax-exempt-status/

Subscribe for updates: https://www.scientologybusiness.com/subscribe/

episodes.title: Scientology's UK School Exposed: The truth about Greenfields
episodes.description:
Scientology's private Greenfields School in East Grinstead is a prime recruitment spot for the Sea Organisation. In this live stream, we'll be looking at the most recent Independent Schools Inspectorate report which shows L Ron Hubbard's 'study tech' isn't quite as successful as Scientology would like you to think.

Read the full ISI report on Greenfields: https://www.isi.net/school/greenfields-school-6492?results=true

BREAKDOWN:
0:00 - Introduction
2:20 - Greenfields
4:58 - Study Technology
8:50 - Does Study Tech work?
10:28 - The latest Greenfields Inspection report
21:25 - Tomorrow’s live
22:12 - Q&A
30:35 - Katie Lohmann update
31:30 - Rounding up

episodes.title: Scientology's empty & poorly managed UK Narconon drug rehab centre
episodes.description:
Scientology’s drug rehabilitation facility, Narconon, is empty and badly managed, according to the UK’s Care Quality Commission. In this video, we take a look at the CQC’s latest report on the Church’s ONLY registered UK charity, which exposes how it only had 2 patients at the time of inspection and ‘requires improvement’ when it comes to how the facility is managed. 

Read the CQC’s full report: https://www.cqc.org.uk/location/1-2138384346

episodes.title: Why Scientology isn't, and CAN'T BE a Charity in the UK
episodes.description:
The Church of Scientology currently operates in the UK through an Australian-registered company called COSRECI - the Church of Scientology Religious Education College Incorporated. In this video, I look at what it would take for the Church to register as a UK charity, and why it's unlikely to be accepted after their 1999 application was declined.

episodes.title: UK Court Reveals Scientology London HQ Is 'Largely Unused'
episodes.description:
In 2005, the Church of Scientology submitted a planning application for their new London 'Ideal Org', saying they expected the building to cater to 300-350 parishioners every day. A January 2023 court case has revealed just how busy the Org is, 18 years later...

episodes.title: "Scientology doesn't improve the community" - Why the UK Charity Commission Rejected Scientology
episodes.description:
In 1999, Scientology applied for charity status with the UK's Charity Commission. It was denied on the basis the Church "was not established for the charitable purpose of promoting the moral or spiritual welfare and improvement of the community."

episodes.title: How Scientology stage their videos to make it look busier than it is
episodes.description:
While working as Scientology's Director of Public Booksales in London, the Church's International Management wanted to show parishioners around the world what a great job we were doing through vide content. Unfortunately, the Org wasn't quite as busy enough to look good on camera, so this is how we managed to fill the shot with people.
